1. Identify all drawn matches (ties) from the table. A tie is represented either by a score of 0 - 0, or by a replay match with the same team on both sides. In our table, there are 3 ties: rows 6, 7, and 13.

2. For each drawn match, check if any of them have a goalless result (0 - 0). From our table, we can see that row 6 has a score of 0 - 0, so it is a goalless draw. Rows 7 and 13 are replays, but they don't provide the initial scores, so we cannot determine whether they were goalless draws.

3. Since only one drawn match (row 6) has a goalless result, our claim can be evaluated as TRUE for "only 1 of the 3 drawn match be goalless".
